::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

:::


The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: M2.4.web.orig v1.0.


> Indicative distributions of these marine pelagic ecosystem functional groups were derived from bathymetric spatial data obtained from Becker et al. (2009) using depth range thresholds cited in respective descriptive profiles for each functional group. Occurrences were mapped at 30 arc second spatial resolution..

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Mapbox tileset ([GeoTIFF version uploaded to Mapbox](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M2_4_web_orig))
 - Zenodo repository (EFG map) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG files](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090918))
 - Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M2.4 Abyssopelagic ocean waters**](/efg-info/M2_4.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Web navigation (**code: M2.4.web.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: M2.4.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

M2.4.web.orig (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M2.4.web.orig_v1.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419) :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090918) :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M2_4_web_orig) :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/)
M2.4.IM.orig (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M2.4.IM.orig_v1.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
